bibl.title: P. Col. VIII 242: Caranis in the Fifth Century.
bibl.note: P. Col. VIII, 242 is a document from very late in the history of Caranis, quite possibly the latest. This letter tells a story of violent resistance by villagers to the sender's attempt to extract tax-money from them and to the police who try to enforce the collection. Revised text, normalized version, translation and notes.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists

bibl.seg: REA John R., P. Col. VIII 242: Caranis in the Fifth Century.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 266-272 et pl. 17.

P. Col. VIII, 242 is a document from very late in the history of Caranis, quite possibly the latest. This letter tells a story of violent resistance by villagers to the sender's attempt to extract tax-money from them and to the police who try to enforce the collection. Revised text, normalized version, translation and notes.
